abstracts.cdata!:
There was also lack of access to legal
            information and little room for citizen participation,
            especially by the poor. A World Bank project aimed to help
            improve the efficiency and accessibility of El
            Salvador's judicial system, helping break a logjam of
            civil and small claims cases, enabling judges to focus on
            judicial rather than administrative duties, and improving
            the overall level of service for the people seeking to use
            the court system. A new judicial map for all the courts of
            El Salvador has been prepared. It is expected to result in
            cost savings and enhance service provision at large urban locations.
